title: Zoom to Linear
description: An interactive visualization demonstrating that sufficiently zoomed-in views of differentiable functions appear linear, matching the tangent line. This illustrates the concept of local linearity, which is fundamental to understanding derivatives and linear approximation.
creator: Claude Code
subject: Mathematics
Calculus
Derivatives
Local Linearity
learningObjectives: Demonstrate that zoomed-in views of differentiable functions appear linear
Observe the relationship between a function and its tangent line
Understand why linear approximation works near a point
Connect visual intuition to the formal definition of the derivative
prerequisites: Familiarity with polynomial, trigonometric, and exponential functions

controls.label: Auto Zoom
controls.description: Automatically animates zoom in and out

controls.label: Reset
controls.description: Resets zoom to 1x and returns to default point

interactions.description: Click and drag on the graph to move the tangent point to a new location on the curve
Moving the zoom slider magnifies the view around the selected point

visualElements.name: Tangent line
visualElements.description: The linear approximation at the selected point

visualElements.name: Center point
visualElements.description: The point where the tangent line touches the curve
